de.larssh.jes

Class JesClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.larssh.jes.JesClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class JesClient
extends Object
implements Closeable
    This class allows to handle IBM z/OS JES spools using Java technologies. The used interface is the IBM z/OS FTP server, that should be available by default.

    JES spool entries can be filtered and listed using list(String, JobStatus, String) and listFilled(String, JobStatus, String) methods, while the later one gathers more information, but takes some more time.

    submit(String) submits JCLs based on the FTP users permissions. waitFor(Job, Duration, Duration) can be used to wait until a job terminates. Job outputs can be retrieved using retrieve(JobOutput) and removed using delete(Job).

    Usage example: The following shows the JesClient used inside a try-with-resource statement. The constructor descriptions describe further details. 

     // Connect and login via simplified constructor
 try (JesClient jesClient = new JesClient(hostname, port, username, password)) {

     // Submit JCL
     Job job = jesClient.submit(jclContent);

     // Wait for job to be finished
     if (!jesClient.waitFor(job)) {
         // Handle the case, a finished job cannot be found inside JES spool any longer
         throw ...;
     }

     // Gather job status details
     Job detailedJob = jesClient.getJobDetails(job);

     // Gather finished jobs outputs
     List<JobOutput> jobOutput = jesClient.get(job);

     // Delete job from JES spool
     jesClient.delete(job);

 // Logout and disconnect using try-with-resource (close method)
 }

    In case filtering jobs does not work as expected, check the JES Interface Level of your server using getServerProperties(). This class requires JESINTERFACELEVEL = 2. The JES Interface Level can be configured by a mainframe administrator inside FTP.DATA.

    See Also:
    IBM Knowledge Center - Interfacing with JES

    • Constructor Detail

      • JesClient

        public JesClient()
        Expert constructor. This constructor creates a FTP client without connecting and logging in. It is meant to be used in scenarios, which require additional FTP configuration.

        Usage example 1 (using a simplified login) 

         // Construct the JES client and its internal FTP client
 try (JesClient jesClient = new JesClient()) {

     // Connect via FTP
     jesClient.getFtpClient().connect(...);

     // Simplified login using the JES client
     jesClient.login(...);

     ...

 // Logout and disconnect using try-with-resource (close method)
 }

        Usage example 2: (using a custom login) 

         // Construct the JES client and its internal FTP client
 try (JesClient jesClient = new JesClient()) {

     // Connect via FTP
     jesClient.getFtpClient().connect(...);

     // Login via FTP client
     jesClient.getFtpClient().login(...);

     // Set the JES spool owner
     jesClient.setJesOwner(...);

     // Enter JES mode of the FTP connection
     jesClient.enterJesMode();

     ...

 // Logout and disconnect using try-with-resource (close method)
 }

      • JesClient

        public JesClient(String hostname,
                 int port,
                 String username,
                 String password)
          throws IOException,
                 JesException
        Simplified constructor. This constructor initiates a new FTP connection and logs in using the given credentials.

        The JesClient can store a JES spool owner. This constructor initializes the JES spool owner using the given username.

        The default port is FTP.DEFAULT_PORT.

        Warning: This constructor calls the overridable method login(String, String), which might lead to uninitialized fields when overriding that method.

        Parameters:
        hostname - FTP hostname
        port - FTP port
        username - FTP username and JES spool owner
        password - FTP password
        Throws:
        IOException - Technical FTP failure
        JesException - Logical JES failure

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IOException
        Logs out and disconnects the FTP connection.
        Specified by:

        Specified by:

        Throws:
        IOException

      • delete

        public void delete(Job job)
            throws IOException,
                   JesException
        Removes a given job from JES spool. This method cares only about the jobs ID.

        In case you do not already have a Job object, deleting by job ID works as follows: 

         String jobId = ...;
 jesClient.delete(new Job(jobId, JesClient.FILTER_WILDCARD, JobStatus.ALL, JesClient.FILTER_WILDCARD));
        Parameters:
        job - Job to be deleted
        Throws:
        IOException - Technical FTP failure
        JesException - Logical JES failure

                  throws IOException,
                         JesException

        Throws:

        JesException - Logical JES failure

               throws IOException,

        Reloads the job from server and returns true if the job is still available and matches the given job status.
        Parameters:

        status - job status or ALL
        Returns:
        true if the job is still available
        Throws:
        IOException - Technical FTP failure
        JesException - Logical JES failure

      • getJobDetails

        public Optional<Job> getJobDetails(Job job)
                            throws IOException,
                                   JesException
        Retrieves up-to-date job details for job. That includes all Job attributes, including a list of JobOutput instances for held jobs.
        Parameters:
        job - job to get up-to-date details for
        Returns:
        job details or Optional.empty() in case the job is no longer available inside JES spool
        Throws:
        IOException - Technical FTP failure
        JesException - Logical JES failure

      • list

        public List<Job> list(String nameFilter)
               throws IOException,
                      JesException
        Returns a list of all job IDs boxed into Job objects matching the given filters. This method has a much higher performance compared to listFilled(String), though that method fills in additional Job fields.

        nameFilter is allowed to end with the wildcard character "*".

        JES does not list more than LIST_LIMIT_MAX entries. In case more entries are available, a JesLimitReachedException is thrown, containing all entries up to the limit.

        Parameters:
        nameFilter - filter by job names
        Returns:
        list of jobs containing job IDs
        Throws:
        IOException - Technical FTP failure
        JesException - Logical JES failure

      • list

        public List<Job> list(String nameFilter,
                      JobStatus status)
               throws IOException,
                      JesException
        Returns a list of all job IDs boxed into Job objects matching the given filters. This method has a much higher performance compared to listFilled(String, JobStatus), though that method fills in additional Job fields.

        nameFilter is allowed to end with the wildcard character "*".

        JES does not list more than LIST_LIMIT_MAX entries. In case more entries are available, a JesLimitReachedException is thrown, containing all entries up to the limit.

        Parameters:
        nameFilter - filter by job names
        status - filter by job status
        Returns:
        list of jobs containing job IDs
        Throws:
        IOException - Technical FTP failure
        JesException - Logical JES failure

      • list

        public List<Job> list(String nameFilter,
                      JobStatus status,
                      String ownerFilter)
               throws IOException,
                      JesException
        Returns a list of all job IDs boxed into Job objects matching the given filters. This method has a much higher performance compared to listFilled(String, JobStatus, String), though that method fills in additional Job fields.

        nameFilter and ownerFilter are allowed to end with the wildcard character "*".

        JES does not list more than LIST_LIMIT_MAX entries. In case more entries are available, a JesLimitReachedException is thrown, containing all entries up to the limit.

        Parameters:
        nameFilter - filter by job names
        status - filter by job status
        ownerFilter - filter by job owner
        Returns:
        list of jobs containing job IDs
        Throws:
        IOException - Technical FTP failure
        JesException - Logical JES failure

      • list

        public List<Job> list(String nameFilter,
                      JobStatus status,
                      String ownerFilter,
                      int limit)
               throws IOException,
                      JesException
        Returns a list of all job IDs boxed into Job objects matching the given filters. This method has a much higher performance compared to listFilled(String, JobStatus, String, int), though that method fills in additional Job fields.

        nameFilter and ownerFilter are allowed to end with the wildcard character "*".

        JES does not list more than limit entries. In case more entries are available, a JesLimitReachedException is thrown, containing all entries up to the limit. limit can be from LIST_LIMIT_MIN (including) to LIST_LIMIT_MAX (including).

        Parameters:
        nameFilter - filter by job names
        status - filter by job status
        ownerFilter - filter by job owner
        limit - limit of spool entries
        Returns:
        list of jobs containing job IDs
        Throws:
        IOException - Technical FTP failure
        JesException - Logical JES failure

      • listFilled

        public List<Job> listFilled(String nameFilter)
                     throws IOException,
                            JesException
        Returns a list of all Job objects matching the given filters. This method has a worse performance compared to list(String), though it fills in additional Job fields.

        nameFilter is allowed to end with the wildcard character "*".

        JES does not list more than LIST_LIMIT_MAX entries. In case more entries are available, a JesLimitReachedException is thrown, containing all entries up to the limit.

        Parameters:
        nameFilter - filter by job names
        Returns:
        list of jobs
        Throws:
        IOException - Technical FTP failure
        JesException - Logical JES failure

      • listFilled

                            JobStatus status)
                     throws IOException,
                            JesException
        Returns a list of all Job objects matching the given filters. This method has a worse performance compared to list(String, JobStatus), though it fills in additional Job fields.

        nameFilter is allowed to end with the wildcard character "*".

        JES does not list more than LIST_LIMIT_MAX entries. In case more entries are available, a JesLimitReachedException is thrown, containing all entries up to the limit.

        Parameters:
        nameFilter - filter by job names
        status - filter by job status
        Returns:
        list of jobs
        Throws:
        IOException - Technical FTP failure
        JesException - Logical JES failure

        Returns a list of all Job objects matching the given filters. This method has a worse performance compared to list(String, JobStatus, String), though it fills in additional Job fields.

        nameFilter and ownerFilter are allowed to end with the wildcard character "*".

        JES does not list more than limit entries. In case more entries are available, a JesLimitReachedException is thrown, containing all entries up to the limit. limit can be from LIST_LIMIT_MIN (including) to LIST_LIMIT_MAX (including).

        Parameters:

        status - filter by job status
        ownerFilter - filter by job owner
        limit - limit of spool entries
        Returns:
        list of jobs
        Throws:
        IOException - Technical FTP failure
        JesException - Logical JES failure

      • login

        public void login(String username,
                  String password)
           throws IOException,
                  JesException
        Shortcut method to perform a FTP login, set the internal JES owner and enter JES mode.

        Is similar to the following lines of code. 

         // Login via FTP client
 jesClient.getFtpClient().login(...);

 // Set the JES spool owner
 jesClient.setJesOwner(...);

 // Enter JES mode of the FTP connection
 jesClient.enterJesMode();
        Parameters:
        username - the user id to be used for FTP login and internal JES owner
        password - the users password
        Throws:
        IOException - Technical FTP failure
        JesException - Logical JES failure

        public String retrieve(JobOutput jobOutput)
                throws IOException,
                       JesException
        Retrieves the content of jobOutput.
        Parameters:
        jobOutput - job output to be requested
        Returns:
        content of the specified job output
        Throws:
        IOException - Technical FTP failure
        JesException - Logical JES failure

      • retrieveOutputs

        public Map<JobOutput,String> retrieveOutputs(Job job)
                                      throws IOException,
                                             JesException
        Retrieves all job outputs of job.
        Parameters:
        job - job to request all outputs of
        Returns:
        map with job output details and the corresponding content in specific order
        Throws:
        IOException - Technical FTP failure
        JesException - Logical JES failure

      • setJesFilters

        protected void setJesFilters(String nameFilter,
                             JobStatus status,
                             String ownerFilter,
                             int limit)
                      throws IOException,
                             JesException
        Sends FTPCmd.SITE commands to set the given filter values.

        nameFilter and ownerFilter are allowed to end with the wildcard character "*".

        limit can be from LIST_LIMIT_MIN (including) to LIST_LIMIT_MAX (including). While that restriction is not checked by this method, values outside that range might result in a server side error message thrown as JesException.

        Parameters:
        nameFilter - filter by job names
        status - filter by job status
        ownerFilter - filter by job owner
        limit - limit of spool entries
        Throws:
        IOException - Technical FTP failure
        JesException - Logical JES failure

      • setJesOwner

        public void setJesOwner(String jesOwner)
        Current JES spool user
        Parameters:
        jesOwner - JES spool owner

      • submit

        public Job submit(String jclContent)
           throws IOException,
                  JesException
        Submits the given JCL and returns a related Job object containing the started jobs ID.

        In addition to the jobs ID this method tries to extract the jobs name from the given JCL. The returned owner is set to the internal JES owner, which can be set using setJesOwner(String).

        Parameters:
        jclContent - JCL to submit
        Returns:
        Job object containing the started jobs ID
        Throws:
        IOException - Technical FTP failure
        JesException - Logical JES failure

      • throwIfLimitReached

        protected List<Job> throwIfLimitReached(int limit,
                                        List<Job> jobs)
                                 throws JesLimitReachedException
        In case the last FTP responses string contains the spool entries limit warning, a JesLimitReachedException is thrown, else jobs are returned.

        The thrown exception contains the current spool entries limit and all entries, which were read already.

        Parameters:
        limit - current spool entries limit
        jobs - list of jobs
        Returns:
        jobs in case the spool entries limit is not reached
        Throws:
        JesLimitReachedException - if the last FTP responses string contains the spool entries limit warning

      • waitFor

        public boolean waitFor(Job job,
                       Duration waiting,
                       Duration timeout)
                throws InterruptedException,
                       IOException,
                       JesException
        Waits for job to be finished using Thread#sleep(long) for waiting between exists(Job, JobStatus) calls and timing out after a given duration. waiting allows to specify the duration to wait.

        The given jobs status specifies, which status are waited for:

        • JobStatus.ALL: waiting for JobStatus.INPUT and JobStatus.ACTIVE
        • JobStatus.INPUT: waiting for JobStatus.INPUT and JobStatus.ACTIVE
        • JobStatus.ACTIVE: waiting for JobStatus.ACTIVE only
        • JobStatus.OUTPUT: returning true with no checks and without waiting
        Parameters:
        job - the job to wait for
        waiting - duration to wait
        timeout - timeout duration
        Returns:
        true if the job finished and false if the timeout has been reached
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if any thread has interrupted the current thread
        IOException - Technical FTP failure
        JesException - Logical JES failure

      • waitFor

        public boolean waitFor(Job job,
                       Duration waiting,
                       Duration timeout,
                       Consumer<Duration> wait)
                throws IOException,
                       JesException
        Waits for job to be finished using wait for waiting between exists(Job, JobStatus) calls and timing out after a given duration. waiting allows to specify the duration to wait.

        The given jobs status specifies, which status are waited for:

        • JobStatus.ALL: waiting for JobStatus.INPUT and JobStatus.ACTIVE
        • JobStatus.INPUT: waiting for JobStatus.INPUT and JobStatus.ACTIVE
        • JobStatus.ACTIVE: waiting for JobStatus.ACTIVE only
        • JobStatus.OUTPUT: returning true with no checks and without waiting
        Parameters:
        job - the job to wait for
        waiting - duration to wait
        timeout - timeout duration
        wait - method to use for waiting
        Returns:
        true if the job finished and false if the timeout has been reached
        Throws:
        IOException - Technical FTP failure
        JesException - Logical JES failure
